1)    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy: Sage V Foods maintains a comprehensive safety, health, and environmental program at the site.  The program includes engineering, education, and enforcement provisions for hazard communication, spill prevention and response, hazardous waste, universal waste, used oil management, waste water and storm water management. 



2)    Emergency Response Program: Sage V Foods has developed an Emergency Response Plan which includes detailed procedures for the following:

a.    Pre-emergency planning and coordination

b.    Personnel roles and lines of authority

c.    Training

d.    Communication

e.    Emergency recognition and prevention

f.    Safe distances and places of refuge

g.    Site security and control

h.    Emergency alerting and response

i.    Ammonia decontamination

j.    Emergency medical treatment and first aid

k.    Critique of response and follow-up

l.    Personal protective and emergency equipment

m.    Medical surveillance



All emergency response personnel undergo training and records of this training are maintained and updated onsite.  The plan outlines specific procedures for evacuations, incident alarms and alerting. 



3)Sage V Foods, in Little Rock Arkansas is located at 5901 Sloane Drive.  The facility is contained on 13.5 acres east of the city of Little Rock.  The facility consists of several structures with over 80,000 square feet under roof.  The primary purpose of Sage V Foods facility is food processing.  Sage V Foods utilizes anhydrous ammonia as the primary means for refrigeration, cooling and freezing.  The facility has one engine room which is located to the south eastern area of the building.  The total capacity of this system is 27,700 pounds.



4)Sage V Foods complies with OSHA's PSM rule as well as EPA's RMP rule and has calculated Worst Case Release Scenario as well as the Alternative Release Scenario circle of impact in case of a release.  The worst case scenario is expected to have a distance to endp

oint of 1.7 miles.  The facility has installed process controls and mitigation devices such as sprinkler system and process area leak detection in order to minimize the potential for an unmitigated release.  In addition, the facility has qualified refrigeration operators onsite who have been trained in emergency response procedures related specifically to the hazards associated with Sage V Foods' process.



5)Sage V Foods has not experienced a reportable release of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years.



6)Sage V Foods will improve safety at the facility, by conducting additional training for operators and maintenance employees.  In addition, management personnel will be required to attend refrigeration (operator) and response training as well.  The facility will continue to review findings of Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) to ensure that implementation of all safety improvements is accomplished.
